tool.name: Overland Flow Distance to Channel Network
tool.description: This tool calculates overland flow distances to a channel network based on gridded digital elevation data and channel network information. The flow algorithm may be either Deterministic 8 (O'Callaghan & Mark 1984) or Multiple Flow Direction (Freeman 1991). Sediment Delivery Rates (SDR) according to Ali & De Boer (2010) can be computed optionally.

param.name: ELEVATION
param.label: Elevation
param.help: A grid that contains elevation data.

param.name: CHANNELS
param.label: Channel Network
param.help: A grid providing information about the channel network. It is assumed that no-data cells are not part of the channel network. Vice versa all others cells are recognised as channel network members.

param.name: ROUTE
param.label: Preferred Routing
param.help: Downhill flow is bound to preferred routing cells, where these are not no-data. Helps to model e.g. small ditches, that are not well represented in the elevation data.

param.name: FIELDS
param.label: Fields
param.help: If set, output is given about the number of fields a flow path visits downhill. For D8 only.

param.name: METHOD
param.label: Flow Algorithm
param.help: Choose a flow routing algorithm that shall be used for the overland flow distance calculation:<br/>- D8<br/>- MFD

param.name: BOUNDARY
param.label: Boundary Cells
param.help: Take cells at the boundary of the DEM as channel.

param.name: FLOW_B
param.label: Beta
param.help: catchment specific parameter for sediment delivery ratio calculation

param.name: FLOW_K
param.label: Manning-Strickler Coefficient
param.help: Manning-Strickler coefficient for flow travel time estimation (reciprocal of Manning's Roughness Coefficient)

param.name: FLOW_K_DEFAULT
param.label: Default
param.help: default value if no grid has been selected

param.name: FLOW_R
param.label: Flow Depth
param.help: flow depth [m] for flow travel time estimation

param.name: FLOW_R_DEFAULT
param.label: Default
param.help: default value if no grid has been selected
